intro: Jacksonia elongata, commonly known as the slender flame flower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its slender, upright stems and narrow leaves make it a distinctive species within its native habitat. Jacksonia elongata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and public landscapes.
